description: Students explore French-speaking regions of the world outside France through the close reading, discussion, and analysis of literary and non-literary texts as well as other cultural artifacts. Readings, discussions, viewings, and written and oral assignments are organized around the exploration of specific topics or themes. Regions include Manitoba, Qu√©bec, the French Caribbean, and North Africa. May be repeated if region is different. Taught in French. Prerequisite: minimum of one 250-level course (two recommended).
name: Fr World: Maghreb Lit

title: The Francophone World
